buckle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to become bent or curved because of heat or pressure, or to make something bend or curve in this way
buckle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The steel pillars began to buckle.
The rails buckled under the intense heat of the fire.
buckle.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if your knees or legs buckle, they become weak and bend
buckle.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: John felt his knees start to buckle.
buckle.translation[0].definitions[2].sig: do something you do not want
buckle.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to do something that you do not want to do because a difficult situation forces you to do it
buckle.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: A weaker person would have buckled under the weight of criticism.
buckle.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to fasten a buckle, or be fastened with a buckle
buckle.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Amy buckled the belt around her waist.
Lou was buckling on his revolver.
buckle.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a piece of metal used for fastening the two ends of a belt, for fastening a shoe, bag etc, or for decoration
